alert.note: Alert for Ashley (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 6:32PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Ashley County through 715 PM CDT... At 631 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near West Crossett, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... West Crossett around 635 PM CDT. Crossett and North Crossett around 645 PM CDT. Berlin around 705 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Blanchton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southeastern Arkansas.
